member.name: T:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent
member.summary: WaitableEvent is a thread synchronization tool that allows one thread to wait for another thread to finish some work. This is equivalent to using a Lock+ConditionVariable to protect a simple boolean value. However, using WaitableEvent in conjunction with a Lock to wait for a more complex state change (e.g., for an item to be added to a queue) is not recommended. In that case consider using a ConditionVariable instead of a WaitableEvent. It is safe to create and/or signal a WaitableEvent from any thread. Blocking on a WaitableEvent by calling the *wait() functions is not allowed on the browser process UI or IO threads.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.Create(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new waitable event. If |automaticReset| is true (1) then the event state is automatically reset to un-signaled after a single waiting thread has been released; otherwise, the state remains signaled until reset() is called manually. If |initiallySignaled| is true (1) then the event will start in the signaled state.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: P:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.IsSignaled
member.summary: Returns true (1) if the event is in the signaled state, else false (0). If the event was created with |automaticReset| set to true (1) then calling this function will also cause a reset.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.Reset
member.summary: Put the event in the un-signaled state.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.Signal
member.summary: Put the event in the signaled state. This causes any thread blocked on Wait to be woken up.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.Wait
member.summary: Wait indefinitely for the event to be signaled. This function will not return until after the call to signal() has completed. This function cannot be called on the browser process UI or IO threads.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.Remote.CfrWaitableEvent.TimedWait(System.Int64)
member.summary: Wait up to |maxMs| milliseconds for the event to be signaled. Returns true (1) if the event was signaled. A return value of false (0) does not necessarily mean that |maxMs| was exceeded. This function will not return until after the call to signal() has completed. This function cannot be called on the browser process UI or IO threads.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/capi/cef_waitable_event_capi.h.

member.name: T:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallbackManager
member.summary: Provides methods and events for managing the remote callback interface.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallbackManager.IncrementCallbackCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancel the callback if this returns false.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallbackManager.SuspendCallbacks(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Suspend all callbacks from the given process. If one or more callbacks from the given process are currently running, this function will block and wait until the last callback returns. After calling this function, all callbacks from the given process will be cancelled and return to the render process without executing any application defined event handlers, delivering default values for return value and out parameters.
Calls to SuspendCallbacks/ResumeCallbacks can be nested. ResumeCallbacks must be called the same number of times as SuspendCallbacks in order to resume execution of callbacks from the given process.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallbackManager.ResumeCallbacks(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Resume all callbacks from the given process. This function returns immedeately.
Calls to SuspendCallbacks/ResumeCallbacks can be nested. ResumeCallbacks must be called at least the same number of times as SuspendCallbacks in order to resume execution of callbacks from the given process.

member.name: T:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext
member.summary: Enables access to static members and constructors of remote (Cfr*) classes. In the scope of a remote callback event, the executing thread is always in the context of the calling thread in the render process.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.ProcessId
member.summary: The process id of the remote process.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.ThreadId
member.summary: Within the scope of a render process callback, the managed thread id of the calling thread in the render process. Zero if the context is not in the scope of a render process callback.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.Enter
member.summary: Enter the context of a remote thread. Calls to Enter()/Exit() must be balanced. Use try/finally constructs to make sure that Exit() is called the same number of times as Enter().

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.Exit
member.summary: Exit the context of a remote thread. Throws an exception if the calling thread is not currently in this remote thread context.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.CurrentContext
member.summary: Returns the current context for the calling thread. Throws an exception if the calling thread is not currently in a remote call context.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxRemoteCallContext.IsInContext
member.summary: True if the calling thread is currently in a remote call context, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo
member.summary: Class representing window information.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/internal/cef_types_win.h and linux/cef/include/internal/cef_types_linux.h.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.SetAsChild(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create the browser as a child window.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.SetAsDisabledChild(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create the browser as a disabled child window.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.SetAsPopup(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Create the browser as a popup window.

member.name: M:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.SetAsWindowless(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create the browser using windowless (off-screen) rendering. No window will be created for the browser and all rendering will occur via the CfxRenderHandler interface. The |parent| value will be used to identify monitor info and to act as the parent window for dialogs, context menus, etc. If |parent| is not provided then the main screen monitor will be used and some functionality that requires a parent window may not function correctly. In order to create windowless browsers the CfxSettings.WindowlessRenderingEnabled value must be set to true. Transparent painting is enabled by default but can be disabled by setting CfxBrowserSettings.BackgroundColor to an opaque value.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.ExStyle
member.summary: Standard parameters required by CreateWindowEx()
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/internal/cef_types_win.h.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.WindowlessRenderingEnabled
member.summary: Set to true (1) to create the browser using windowless (off-screen) rendering. No window will be created for the browser and all rendering will occur via the CfxRenderHandler interface. The |parentWindow| value will be used to identify monitor info and to act as the parent window for dialogs, context menus, etc. If |parentWindow| is not provided then the main screen monitor will be used and some functionality that requires a parent window may not function correctly. In order to create windowless browsers the CfxSettings.WindowlessRenderingEnabled value must be set to true.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/internal/cef_types_win.h and linux/cef/include/internal/cef_types_linux.h.

member.name: P:Chromium.CfxWindowInfo.Window
member.summary: Handle for the new browser window. Only used with windowed rendering.
member.remarks: See also the original CEF documentation in cef/include/internal/cef_types_win.h and linux/cef/include/internal/cef_types_linux.h.

member.name: T:Chromium.WindowStyle
member.summary: Window Styles. The following styles can be specified wherever a window style is required. After the control has been created, these styles cannot be modified, except as noted.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_SIZEFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Chromium.WindowStyle.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.
